title: Chinese donation of medicines and medical equipment to Vanuatu in 2017
description: On February 8th, 2017, the Chinese government held a handover ceremony for the donation of medicine and medical equipment (or 援瓦医疗技术合作项目药品及医疗设备). The donation is part of the medical and technical cooperation agreement for Santo and Port Vila. Under this agreement, the Chinese government has also sent medical teams to the Santo Northern Hospital and the Port Vila Central Hospital since 1985 and 1993, respectively.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese donation of medicines and medical equipment to Vanuatu in 2017

# Description
On February 8th, 2017, the Chinese government held a handover ceremony for the donation of medicine and medical equipment (or 援瓦医疗技术合作项目药品及医疗设备). The donation is part of the medical and technical cooperation agreement for Santo and Port Vila. Under this agreement, the Chinese government has also sent medical teams to the Santo Northern Hospital and the Port Vila Central Hospital since 1985 and 1993, respectively.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare donations and medical cooperation without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of medicine and medical equipment, medical and technical cooperation agreement, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Embassy donates school bags to Port Vila Central School in Vanuatu
description: On February 17th, 2017, the Chinese Ambassador held a handover ceremony for the donation of school bags to Port Vila Central School (or 向维拉中心学校捐赠书包). At the donation ceremony, Ambassador Liu Quan and Principal Alex signed a donation transfer certificate, and nearly 400 teachers and students attended ("驻瓦努阿图大使刘全向维拉中心学校捐赠书包").
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates school bags to Port Vila Central School in Vanuatu

# Description
On February 17th, 2017, the Chinese Ambassador held a handover ceremony for the donation of school bags to Port Vila Central School (or 向维拉中心学校捐赠书包). At the donation ceremony, Ambassador Liu Quan and Principal Alex signed a donation transfer certificate, and nearly 400 teachers and students attended ("驻瓦努阿图大使刘全向维拉中心学校捐赠书包").
justification: Project is a social development initiative with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of school bags to educational institution, no energy or infrastructure components

title: Chinese Embassy donates disaster relief aid after Hurricane Donna to Vanuatu
description: On July 4th, 2017, a handover ceremony was held for the donation of disaster relief aid, after Hurricane Donna hit the northern part of the country (or 向瓦政府提供多娜飓风救灾物资). At the request of the government of Vanuatu, the Chinese embassy in the country purchased a certain amount of production materials to support the government and people in the post-disaster reconstruction work ("驻瓦努阿图使馆向瓦政府提供多娜飓风救灾物资").The value and contents of the donation are unknown. In May 2017, Hurricane Donna hit many parts of northern Vanuatu, which caused damage to local houses and severely affected people's lives.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates disaster relief aid after Hurricane Donna to Vanuatu

# Description
On July 4th, 2017, a handover ceremony was held for the donation of disaster relief aid, after Hurricane Donna hit the northern part of the country (or 向瓦政府提供多娜飓风救灾物资). At the request of the government of Vanuatu, the Chinese embassy in the country purchased a certain amount of production materials to support the government and people in the post-disaster reconstruction work ("驻瓦努阿图使馆向瓦政府提供多娜飓风救灾物资").The value and contents of the donation are unknown. In May 2017, Hurricane Donna hit many parts of northern Vanuatu, which caused damage to local houses and severely affected people's lives.
justification: Project is focused on disaster relief and humanitarian aid without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Disaster relief aid donation, post-disaster reconstruction support, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Guangdong Medical Mission visited National Eye Clinic at Port Vila in Vanuatu
description: On July 10th-12, 2017, the Guangdong Medical Mission visited the National Eye clinic at Port Vila Central Hospital (or 开展送医上岛活动). The team comprised six doctors and they treated nearly 100 patients including 14 cataract patients who successfully got treatment of cataract extraction. Rehabilitation experts used traditional Chinese medicine for patients to relieve the pain ("广东省医疗团在瓦努阿图开展送医上岛活动").
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Guangdong Medical Mission visited National Eye Clinic at Port Vila in Vanuatu

# Description
On July 10th-12, 2017, the Guangdong Medical Mission visited the National Eye clinic at Port Vila Central Hospital (or 开展送医上岛活动). The team comprised six doctors and they treated nearly 100 patients including 14 cataract patients who successfully got treatment of cataract extraction. Rehabilitation experts used traditional Chinese medicine for patients to relieve the pain ("广东省医疗团在瓦努阿图开展送医上岛活动").
justification: Project is focused on healthcare services with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical mission providing eye care and cataract treatment, use of traditional Chinese medicine for pain relief

title: Chinese Government provides $300,000 grant in October 2017 following Ambae Volcano eruption
description: In October 2017, the Chinese Government donated USD 300,000 to the Vanuatu Government to assist in the country's response to the Ambae volcanic disaster.   Ambae Volcano erupted in October 2017 and and March 2018.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government provides $300,000 grant in October 2017 following Ambae Volcano eruption

# Description
In October 2017, the Chinese Government donated USD 300,000 to the Vanuatu Government to assist in the country's response to the Ambae volcanic disaster.   Ambae Volcano erupted in October 2017 and and March 2018.
justification: Emergency response grant for disaster relief with no direct energy or environmental implications
evidence: USD 300,000 grant for volcanic disaster response, humanitarian focus

title: Chinese People's Liberation Army donates exercise books, pens, color pencils, school bags, and balls to Port Vila Central School
description: On June 25, 2017, the Chinese People's Liberation Army donated exercise books, pens, color pencils, school bags, and balls to the Port Vila Central School. The donation was presented to the school by two senior Chinese naval officers.  The financial value of the donation is unknown.
combined_text:

Chinese People's Liberation Army donates exercise books, pens, color pencils, school bags, and balls to Port Vila Central School

# Description
On June 25, 2017, the Chinese People's Liberation Army donated exercise books, pens, color pencils, school bags, and balls to the Port Vila Central School. The donation was presented to the school by two senior Chinese naval officers.  The financial value of the donation is unknown.
justification: Project involves donation of educational materials with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of exercise books, pens, color pencils, school bags, and balls to a school

title: Chinese Ambassador to Venezuela gifted books on Chinese culture and governance to Venezuelan Minister of Education
description: On March 2, 2017, Zhao Bentang, the Chinese Ambassador to Venezuela, met with Elías Jaua, the Venezuelan Minister of Education and Vice-Chairman of Venezuela’s Social Development and People’s Livelihood Program. Throughout the meeting, both representatives discussed the benefits of past collaboration in cultural education and possibilities for strengthening cooperation in the field of education.   Following the meeting, Ambassador Zhao gifted the Spanish version of “Xi Jinping: The Governance of the Country” in addition to other books to Minister Elías Jaua. The three volumes (published in 2014, 2017, and 2020) of  “The Governance of China” contains a collection of speeches and writings by Xi Jinping, articulating his political philosophy about Chinese economics, international affairs, technology, and peaceful co-existence. Ambassador Zhao also gifted the Spanish version of the book to Davila, the Editor-in-Chief of Últimas Noticias newspaper (see project ID #90042), Eduardo Mendez, the Executive Director of the Simón Bolívar Music Foundation (see project ID #90062), Gutierrez, the President of the Venezuelan Supreme Court Committee (see project ID #90045),  Gregorio Montero, the Secretary-General of CLAD (see project ID #90126), Ruben Dario Molina, the Venezuelan Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs (see project ID #90128), and to Tibisay Lucena, the President of Venezuela’s National Election Commission (see project ID #90130) across various diplomatic visits and meetings.
staff_comments: Although the projects mentioned within the description aren’t connected, they are mentioned because Ambassador Zhao gifted the same book throughout all the projects.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Ambassador to Venezuela gifted books on Chinese culture and governance to Venezuelan Minister of Education

# Description
On March 2, 2017, Zhao Bentang, the Chinese Ambassador to Venezuela, met with Elías Jaua, the Venezuelan Minister of Education and Vice-Chairman of Venezuela’s Social Development and People’s Livelihood Program. Throughout the meeting, both representatives discussed the benefits of past collaboration in cultural education and possibilities for strengthening cooperation in the field of education.   Following the meeting, Ambassador Zhao gifted the Spanish version of “Xi Jinping: The Governance of the Country” in addition to other books to Minister Elías Jaua. The three volumes (published in 2014, 2017, and 2020) of  “The Governance of China” contains a collection of speeches and writings by Xi Jinping, articulating his political philosophy about Chinese economics, international affairs, technology, and peaceful co-existence. Ambassador Zhao also gifted the Spanish version of the book to Davila, the Editor-in-Chief of Últimas Noticias newspaper (see project ID #90042), Eduardo Mendez, the Executive Director of the Simón Bolívar Music Foundation (see project ID #90062), Gutierrez, the President of the Venezuelan Supreme Court Committee (see project ID #90045),  Gregorio Montero, the Secretary-General of CLAD (see project ID #90126), Ruben Dario Molina, the Venezuelan Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs (see project ID #90128), and to Tibisay Lucena, the President of Venezuela’s National Election Commission (see project ID #90130) across various diplomatic visits and meetings.
justification: Project involves cultural exchange and education, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Gifting of books on Chinese culture and governance, focus on education and cultural collaboration

title: Chinese Embassy donates 385 books to Venezuela's National Library in 2017
description: On September 26, 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Venezuela donated 386 books by Chinese authors to the National Library of Venezuela. These books included Chinese President Xi Jinping's book "The Governance of China" and works on Chinese leadership, culture, and progress.
staff_comments: The National Library of Venezuela is also known as, 'La Biblioteca Nacional de Venezuela' in Spanish and '委内瑞拉国家图书馆' in Chinese.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates 385 books to Venezuela's National Library in 2017

# Description
On September 26, 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Venezuela donated 386 books by Chinese authors to the National Library of Venezuela. These books included Chinese President Xi Jinping's book "The Governance of China" and works on Chinese leadership, culture, and progress.
justification: Project involves cultural exchange and education through book donation
evidence: Donation of 386 books to National Library, including works on Chinese culture and leadership

title: CITIC provides repair assistance to Tiana Primary School in  Venezuela in 2016
description: In 2016, the state-owned company, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd., sent construction teams to repair four classrooms within the Tiuna Primary School in the barracks of Venezuela’s capital, Caracas. According to Herminia, the school's principal, the previous state of the classrooms severely threatened the safety of 39 students, as the walls were cracked. The CITIC construction teams repaired the damages within the classrooms free of charge.   The residents of Tiuna greatly appreciate the company’s aid as they develop the Tiuna Social Housing Project with the Government of Venezuela in constructing affordable housing for low and middle-income individuals.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
CITIC provides repair assistance to Tiana Primary School in  Venezuela in 2016

# Description
In 2016, the state-owned company, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd., sent construction teams to repair four classrooms within the Tiuna Primary School in the barracks of Venezuela’s capital, Caracas. According to Herminia, the school's principal, the previous state of the classrooms severely threatened the safety of 39 students, as the walls were cracked. The CITIC construction teams repaired the damages within the classrooms free of charge.   The residents of Tiuna greatly appreciate the company’s aid as they develop the Tiuna Social Housing Project with the Government of Venezuela in constructing affordable housing for low and middle-income individuals.
justification: Project focuses on educational infrastructure repair without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Repair of school classrooms, social development focus, no energy-related components mentioned

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 1.678 million government concessional loan for Cat Linh-Ha Dong Light Rail Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#34616, #73326)
description: On May 30, 2008, the Chinese Government and and the Government of Vietnam signed a preferential loan framework agreement for the Cat Linh-Ha Dong Light Rail Construction Project. This subsequently produced three different loan agreements:  (1) On October 22, 2008, China Eximbank and the Vietnam Ministry of Finance signed an RMB 1.2 billion ($169 million) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No.(14) Total No.(223)] for this railway project (see Project #73326). The borrowing terms of the GCL were as follows: 3% interest rate, 15-year maturity, and 5-year maturity.  (2) On November 8, 2009, China Eximbank and the Vietnam Ministry of Finance signed a $250 million preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK PBC No.2009 (24) Total No. (86)] for this railway project (see Project #34616). The borrowing terms of the PBC were as follows: 4% interest rate, 15-year maturity, and 5-year maturity.  (3) On May 11, 2017, China Eximbank and the Vietnam Ministry of Finance signed an RMB 1.678 million ($250.62 million) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No.2017 (24) Total No. (629)] for this railway project (Project #63214). The loan terms are unknown. This GCL came into effect on December 28, 2017 and the fist disbursement took place on April 28, 2018.   The borrower was to use the proceeds from these loans to partially finance an EPC contract with China Railway Sixth Bureau Group Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of China Railway Group. The purpose of the project is to construct a 13 km light rail — that travels at 80 km per hour — in the capital city of Hanoi that passes through 12 stations: Cat Linh, La Thanh, Thai Ha, Lang, Thuong Dinh, Vanh Dai 3, Phung Khoang, Van Quan, Ha Dong, La Khe, Van Khe, Yen Nghia. The project officially commenced on October 10, 2011 and the new railway line was originally scheduled to launch in June 2015, but the completion date of the project has been postponed at least four times.  The project has encountered multiple problems and delays during implementation. In 2013, the project faced difficulties related to demolition and relocation, including the fact that the terrain was ideal for machinery and the construction site was close to traffic. Then, in 2014, the total cost of the project increased from $552.86 million to $868.04 million, forcing the Government of Vietnam to contract a supplementary loan from China Eximbank (see Project #63214).  In January 2015, the project faced major criticism from the Vietnamese government for multiple accidents during construction. Vietnamese officials and experts have repeatedly raised concerns about the project’s safety, with several accidents killing or injuring workers and passersby. In early 2016, Vietnam’s Ministry of Transport and China Railway Sixth Bureau Group Co., Ltd agreed on a new launch date in December 2016, before correcting themselves that the line would not be launched until early 2017. In February 2017, the railway line’s completion was postponed for another year, with a new launch set for February 2018.  In February 2017, the first set of trains (out of 13 total) was installed on the track . Each train is worth $63.2 million, and manufactured by China's Beijing Subway Rolling Stock Equipment Ltd. In 2018, the project manager submitted a proposal for the railway line to begin a test run in September 2018, setting the date for an official launch to be in 2021. On September 20, 2018, the first stage of a trial run was initiated, which was meant to last 3-6 months. The project is currently slated for completion on April 30, 2021. More than 600 people were reportedly hired to support the implementation of this project. Photos were taken on November 6th 2021 as the first commercial operation to the railway commenced, marking the completion of the project.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Line 2A of the Hanoi Metro Project, the 13km Hanoi Light Rail Line 1 Project, the Hanoi Cat Linh to Ha Dong Light Rail Project, the Cat Linh-Hadong Metro Line Project, the Hanoi-Hadong Urban Railway Line Project, the Cat Linh-Ha Dong Flyover Project, the Cat Linh-Ha Dong Skytrain Project, and the Hanoi Urban Railway Project. The Vietnamese project title is dự án đường sắt Cát Linh - Hà Đông or dự án đường sắt đô thị Hà Nội. The Chinese project title is 河内轻轨二号线项目 or 越南河内轻轨项目.2. None of the China Eximbank loans (collectively worth $669.62 million) that supported this project are included in the Overseas Development Finance Dataset that Boston University’s Global Development Policy Center published in December 2020.3. All key financing details are found in sources #136981 and #136985. The former outlines a draft report to the Vietnam National Assembly and the latter is a official decision document from the Vietnam Ministry of Transport.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 1.678 million government concessional loan for Cat Linh-Ha Dong Light Rail Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#34616, #73326)

# Description
On May 30, 2008, the Chinese Government and and the Government of Vietnam signed a preferential loan framework agreement for the Cat Linh-Ha Dong Light Rail Construction Project. This subsequently produced three different loan agreements:  (1) On October 22, 2008, China Eximbank and the Vietnam Ministry of Finance signed an RMB 1.2 billion ($169 million) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No.(14) Total No.(223)] for this railway project (see Project #73326). The borrowing terms of the GCL were as follows: 3% interest rate, 15-year maturity, and 5-year maturity.  (2) On November 8, 2009, China Eximbank and the Vietnam Ministry of Finance signed a $250 million preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK PBC No.2009 (24) Total No. (86)] for this railway project (see Project #34616). The borrowing terms of the PBC were as follows: 4% interest rate, 15-year maturity, and 5-year maturity.  (3) On May 11, 2017, China Eximbank and the Vietnam Ministry of Finance signed an RMB 1.678 million ($250.62 million) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No.2017 (24) Total No. (629)] for this railway project (Project #63214). The loan terms are unknown. This GCL came into effect on December 28, 2017 and the fist disbursement took place on April 28, 2018.   The borrower was to use the proceeds from these loans to partially finance an EPC contract with China Railway Sixth Bureau Group Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of China Railway Group. The purpose of the project is to construct a 13 km light rail — that travels at 80 km per hour — in the capital city of Hanoi that passes through 12 stations: Cat Linh, La Thanh, Thai Ha, Lang, Thuong Dinh, Vanh Dai 3, Phung Khoang, Van Quan, Ha Dong, La Khe, Van Khe, Yen Nghia. The project officially commenced on October 10, 2011 and the new railway line was originally scheduled to launch in June 2015, but the completion date of the project has been postponed at least four times.  The project has encountered multiple problems and delays during implementation. In 2013, the project faced difficulties related to demolition and relocation, including the fact that the terrain was ideal for machinery and the construction site was close to traffic. Then, in 2014, the total cost of the project increased from $552.86 million to $868.04 million, forcing the Government of Vietnam to contract a supplementary loan from China Eximbank (see Project #63214).  In January 2015, the project faced major criticism from the Vietnamese government for multiple accidents during construction. Vietnamese officials and experts have repeatedly raised concerns about the project’s safety, with several accidents killing or injuring workers and passersby. In early 2016, Vietnam’s Ministry of Transport and China Railway Sixth Bureau Group Co., Ltd agreed on a new launch date in December 2016, before correcting themselves that the line would not be launched until early 2017. In February 2017, the railway line’s completion was postponed for another year, with a new launch set for February 2018.  In February 2017, the first set of trains (out of 13 total) was installed on the track . Each train is worth $63.2 million, and manufactured by China's Beijing Subway Rolling Stock Equipment Ltd. In 2018, the project manager submitted a proposal for the railway line to begin a test run in September 2018, setting the date for an official launch to be in 2021. On September 20, 2018, the first stage of a trial run was initiated, which was meant to last 3-6 months. The project is currently slated for completion on April 30, 2021. More than 600 people were reportedly hired to support the implementation of this project. Photos were taken on November 6th 2021 as the first commercial operation to the railway commenced, marking the completion of the project.
justification: The project focuses on urban light rail construction, which is general infrastructure development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of 13 km light rail with 12 stations, urban transportation focus
